English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 120
1716200.text:
Buraidah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The sanctity of the wives of Mujahidun (i.e., those who strive hard and fight in the way of Allah) for those who remain at home (i.e., those who do not go to the battlefield to fight Jihad) is like the sanctity of their own mothers. Anyone who remains behind to look after the family of a Mujahid and betrays his trust, will be made to stand on the Day of Resurrection before the Mujahid who will take away from his meritorious deeds whatever he likes till he is satisfied." The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turned toward us and said, "Now, what do you think (i.e., will he leave anything with him)?"

[Muslim].

1716210.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716210.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716210
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 121
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 121
1716210.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed those men who are effeminate, and women who imitate men.

Another narration is: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed men who copy women and cursed women who copy men.

[Al-Bukhari].

1716220.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716220.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716220
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 122
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 122
1716220.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed a man who puts on the dress of women, and a woman who puts on the dress of men.

[Abu Dawud].

1716230.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716230.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716230
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 123
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 123
1716230.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "There are two types of people who will be punished in Hell and whom I have not seen: men having whips like the tails of cows and they will be beating people with them, and, women who will be dressed but appear to be naked, inviting to evil; and they themselves will be inclined to it. Their heads will appear like the humps of the Bactrian camel inclined to one side. They will not enter Jannah and they will not smell its fragrance which is perceptible from such and such a distance."

[Muslim].

1716240.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716240.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716240
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 124
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 124
1716240.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as saying: "Do not eat with your left hand, because Satan eats and drinks with his left hand."

[Muslim].

1716250.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716250.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716250
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 125
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 125
1716250.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "No person should eat and drink with his left hand for Satan eats with his left hand and drinks with his left hand."

[Muslim].

1716260.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716260.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716260
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 126
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 126
1716260.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as saying: "Jews and Christians do not dye their hair, so act differently from them."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716270.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716270.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716270
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 127
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 127
1716270.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
Abu Quhafah, father of Abu Bakr (May Allah be pleased with them) was presented to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the day of the conquest of Makkah and his head and beard were snow white. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Change it (i.e., dye it and avoid black colour)."

[Muslim].

1716280.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716280.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716280
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 128
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 128
1716280.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade shaving a part of the head.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716290.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716290.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716290
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 129
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 129
1716290.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saw a boy, some portion of whose head was shaved and some of it was left out. He prohibited them from that and said, "Shave the whole of it or leave the whole of it."

[Muslim].

1716300.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716300.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716300
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 130
1716300.text:
'Abdullah bin Ja'far (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) gave respite for three days to the family of Ja'far (after his martydom). Then he came and said, "Don't weep for my brother after this day." He said, "Bring all of my nephews to me." We were accordingly brought as if we were chickens. Then he said, "Call for me a barber." He directed him to shave our heads which he did.

[Abu Dawud].

1716310.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716310.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716310
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 131
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 131
1716310.text:
'Ali (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited a woman from shaving her head.

[An- Nasa'i].

1716321.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716321.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716321
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 132
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 132
1716321.text:
Asma' (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
A woman came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said: "O Messenger of Allah! I have a daughter who had an attack of small pox and her hair fell off. Now I want to celebrate her marriage. Can I get her a wig?" Thereupon the Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Allah has cursed the maker and wearer of a wig."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716322.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716322.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716322
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 133
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 133
1716322.text: A similar narration was narrated on the authority of 'Aishah.

1716333.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716333.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716333
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 134
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 134
1716333.text:
Humaid bin 'Abdur-Rahman (May Allah be pleased wth him) said:
I saw Mu'awiyah (May Allah be pleased with him) during the Hajj (pilgrimage) standing on the pulpit. He took from the guard a bunch of hair, and said: "O people of Al-Madinah! Where are your scholars? (Why do they do not prohibit you) I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) prohibiting from using this (false hair) and saying, 'The people of Bani Israel were ruined when their women wore such hair."'

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim]

1716340.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716340.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716340
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 135
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 135
1716340.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed the maker and wearer of a wig and the tattooer and the one who is tattooed.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716350.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716350.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716350
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 136
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 136
1716350.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
Allah has cursed those women who practise tattooing and those women who have themselves tattooed, and those women who get their hair removed from their eyebrows and faces (except the beard and the mustache), and those who make artificial spaces between their teeth for beauty, whereby they change Allah's creation. A woman started to argue with him, saying: "What is all this?" He replied: "Why should I not curse those whom the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed and who are cursed in Allah's Book? Allah, the Exalted, has said in His Book:

"And whatsoever the Messenger (Muhammad (ﷺ)) gives you, take it; and whatsoever he forbids you, abstain (from it)." (59:7)

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716370.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716370.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716370
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 137
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 137
1716370.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who does something contrary to our way (i.e., Islam) will have it rejected."

[Muslim].

1716380.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716380.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716380
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 138
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 138
1716380.text:
Abu Qatadah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not touch your private parts with your right hand while urinating, nor for washing or cleaning (your private parts); and do not breathe into the drinking vessel from which you drink."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716390.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716390.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716390
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 139
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 139
1716390.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "None of you should walk wearing one shoe; you should either wear them both or take them off both."

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim].

1716400.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716400.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716400
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 140
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 140
1716400.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "When the lace of one of the shoes of any one of you is cut off, he should not walk with the other until he has got the lace repaired."

[Muslim].

1716410.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716410.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716410
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 141
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 141
1716410.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade a person wearing (tying up) his shoe while standing.

[Abu Dawud with a good Isnad].

1716420.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716420.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716420
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 142
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 142
1716420.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not keep the fire burning in your homes when you go to bed."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716430.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716430.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716430
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 143
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 143
1716430.text:
Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
A house in Al-Madinah was burnt with its occupants inside it one night. When this was reported to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) he said, "Fire is your enemy. So, put it out before going to bed."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716440.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716440.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716440
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 144
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 144
1716440.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Cover up the (kitchen) containers (i.e., pots, pans, etc.), tie up the mouth of the water-skin, lock up the doors and extinguish the lamps, because Satan can neither untie the water-skin nor open the door nor uncover the containers. If one can cover the cooking pot even by placing a piece of wood across it, and pronounce the Name of Allah on it, let him do it. A mouse can sometimes cause a house to burn along its dwellers."

[Muslim]

1716450.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716450.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716450
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 145
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 145
1716450.text:
'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
We have been forbidden to go into excess.

[Al-Bukhari].

1716460.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716460.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716460
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 146
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 146
1716460.text:
Masruq (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
We visited 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) and he said to us: O people! He who has the knowledge of any matter may convey it to the others. And he who has no knowledge, thereof, should say: "Allahu a'lam (Allah knows better)." It is a part and parcel of knowledge that a man who has no knowledge of a matter should say: "Allah knows better." Allah said to His Prophet (ﷺ):

"Say (O Muhammad (ﷺ)): 'No wage do I ask of you for this (the Qur'an), nor am I one of the Mutakallifun (those who pretend and fabricate things which do not exist)."' (38:86)

[Al-Bukhari].

1716470.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716470.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716470
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 147
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 147
1716470.text:
'Umar bin Al-Khattab (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "The deceased is tortured in his grave for bewailing over him."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716480.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716480.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716480
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 148
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 148
1716480.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who (on befalling a calamity) slaps his cheeks, tears his clothes and follows the ways and traditions of the Days of Ignorance is none of us."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716490.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716490.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716490
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 149
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 149
1716490.text:
Abu Burdah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
(My father) Abu Musa got seriously ill and lost his consciousness. His head was in the lap of a woman of the family and she began to wail. When Abu Musa recovered his consciousness, he said: "I am innocent of those from whom Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) is innocent. Verily, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) declared himself free of (the responsibility) for a woman who wails, shaves her head and tears up her clothes."

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim].

1716500.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716500.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716500
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 150
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 150
1716500.text:
Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "He who allows (others) to wail over his death, will be punished for it on the Day of Resurrection."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716510.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716510.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716510
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 151
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 151
1716510.text:
Umm 'Atiyyah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
At the time of giving the pledge of allegiance, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) took from us an oath that we would not wail.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716520.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716520.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716520
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 152
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 152
1716520.text:
An-Nu'man bin Bashir (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
When 'Abdullah bin Rawahah (May Allah be pleased with him) became unconscious, his sister began to weep and shout: "Alas! For the mountain among men. Alas! for such and such (mentioning his virtuous qualities)." When he recovered his consciousness, he said: "I was asked (disapprovingly, by the angels) about everything you said concerning me whether I am as you said."

[Al- Bukhari].

1716530.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716530.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716530
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 153
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 153
1716530.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) visited Sa'd bin 'Ubadah during his illness. He was accompanied by 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Auf, Sa'd bin Abu Waqqas and 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with them). When they entered his house, they found him unconscious. The Messenger of Allah asked, "Has he died?" They replied: "No, O Messenger of Allah." Hearing this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) began to weep. When his Companions saw this, they also began to weep too. He said, "Listen attentively: Allah does not punish for the shedding of tears or the grief of the heart, but takes to task or show mercy because of the utterances of this (and he pointed to his tongue)."

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim].

1716540.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716540.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716540
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 154
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 154
1716540.text:
Abu Malik Al-Ash'ari (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If the wailing woman does not repent before she dies, she will be made to stand on the Day of Resurrection wearing a garment of pitch and a garment of scabies (Allah knows the nature thereof)."

[Muslim].

1716550.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716550.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716550
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 155
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 155
1716550.text:
Asid bin Abu Usaid reported:
A woman who had taken a pledge of allegiance at the hand of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Among the matters in respect of which we gave the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) the pledge not to disobey him in any Ma'ruf [i.e., all that Islam ordains (V:60:12)] was that we should not slap our faces, bewail, tear our clothes up and tear out our hair (in grief)."

[Abu Dawud].

1716560.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716560.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716560
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 156
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 156
1716560.text:
Abu Musa (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If anyone dies and the mourner gets up and says: 'Alas! For the mountain among men. Alas! For the chief ...' and such like, Allah will put two angels in charge of him who will beat on the breast and ask him (disapproving): 'Were you like that?' "

[At- Tirmidhi].

1716570.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716570.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716570
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 157
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 157
1716570.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Two things are signs of disbelief on the part of those who indulge in them: Slandering one's lineage and wailing over the dead."

[Muslim].

1716580.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716580.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716580
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 158
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 158
1716580.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
Some people asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about soothsayers. He (ﷺ) said, "They are of no account." Upon this they said to him, "O Messenger of Allah! But they sometimes make true predictions." Thereupon the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "That is a word pertaining to truth which a jinn snatches (from the angels) and whispers into the ears of his friend (the soothsayers) who will then mix more than a hundred lies with it."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

The narration in Al-Bukhari is: "The angels descend in the clouds and mention matters which has been decreed in heaven; Satan steals a hearing (listens to it stealthily) and communicates it to the soothsayers who tell along with it a hundred lies."

1716590.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716590.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716590
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 159
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 159
1716590.text:
Narrated Safiyyah, daughter of Abu 'Ubaid, on the authority of some of the wives of the Prophet (ﷺ) who said, "He who goes to one who claims to tell about matters of the Unseen and believes in him, his Salat (prayers) will not be accepted for forty days."

[Muslim].

1716600.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716600.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716600
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 160
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 160
1716600.text:
Qabisah bin Al-Mukhariq (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "The practice of 'Iyafah, the interpretation of omens from the flight of birds, the practice of divination by drawing lines on the ground and taking evil omens are all practices of Al-Jibt (the idol, the diviner, or sorcerer)."

[Abu Dawud].

1716610.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716610.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716610
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 161
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 161
1716610.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who acquires a branch of the knowledge of astrology, learns a branch of magic (of which he acquires more as long as) he continues to do so."

[Abu Dawud].

1716620.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716620.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716620
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 162
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 162
1716620.text:
Mu'awiyah bin Al-Hakam (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
I said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have recently emerged from ignorance and Allah has favoured me with Islam. There are still some men among us who visit the soothsayers to consult them (on matters relating to the future)." He (ﷺ) replied, "Do not visit them." I said: "There are some men who are guided by omens." He replied, "These are the ideas which come up in their minds but you should not be influenced by them (i.e., these things) should not prevent them from pursuing their works." I said: "There are some men who practise divination by drawing lines on the ground." The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) replied, "There was a Prophet who drew lines, the line which agrees with the line drawn by that Prophet would be correct."

[Muslim].

1716630.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716630.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716630
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 163
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 163
1716630.text:
Abu Mas'ud Al-Badri (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited the price of a dog, the earning of an prostitute, and the money given to a soothsayer.

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim].

1716640.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716640.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716640
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 164
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 164
1716640.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Not the transmission of disease of one person to another and no evil omen, but I am pleased with good omens." He was asked: "What is good omen?" He replied, "A good word."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716650.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716650.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716650
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 165
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 165
1716650.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "There is no infection and no evil omen; but if there is anything (that may be a source of trouble) then it could be a house, a horse, and a woman."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716660.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716660.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716660
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 166
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 166
1716660.text:
Buraidah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet never took ill omens.

[Abu Dawud].

1716670.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716670.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716670
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 167
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 167
1716670.text:
'Urwah bin 'Amir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
When talking of omens was mentioned in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) he said, "The best type of omen is the good omen." He added, "A Muslim should not refrain from anything because of an omen." He (ﷺ) told them, "When any of you sees anything which he dislikes, he should say: 'Allahuma la ya'ti bil-hasanati illa Anta, wa la yadfa'us- sayyi'ati illa Anta, wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa Bika (O Allah ! You Alone bring good things; You Alone avert evil things, and there is no might or power but in You)."'

[Abu Dawud with Sahih Isnad].

1716680.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716680.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716680
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 168
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 168
1716680.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Those who draw pictures will be punished on the Day of Resurrection; and it will be said to them: 'Breathe soul into what you have created."'

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716690.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716690.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716690
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 169
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 169
1716690.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) visited me after returning from a journey, and I had a shelf with a thin cloth curtain hanging over it and on which there were portraits. When he saw it, the colour of his face changed (because of anger) and he said, "O 'Aishah! the most grievous torment from Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be for those who imitate (Allah) in the act of His creation." 'Aishah said: We tore it into pieces and made a cushion or two cushions out of that.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716700.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716700.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716700
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 170
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 170
1716700.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "Every painter will go to Hell, and for every portrait he has made, there will be appointed one who will chastise him in the Hell." Ibn 'Abbas said: If you have to do it, draw pictures of trees and other inanimate things.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716710.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716710.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716710
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 171
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 171
1716710.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "Whosoever makes a picture, will be punished on the Day of Resurrection, and will be asked to infuse soul therein, which he will not be able to do."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716720.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716720.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716720
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 172
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 172
1716720.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "Those who will receive the most severe punishment from Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be painters (of living objects)."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716730.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716730.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716730
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 173
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 173
1716730.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The Almighty Allah said: 'Who is more an oppressor than him who goes to create like My creation? Let him make an ant or a grain of corn or a grain of barley."'

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716740.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716740.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716740
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 174
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 174
1716740.text:
Abu Talhah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a portrait."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716750.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716750.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716750
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 175
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 175
1716750.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
Jibril (Gabriel) promised to visit the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) but delayed and this grieved him very much. When he came out of his house, Jibril met him. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) asked him about the reason of delay, and he replied: "We do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a portrait."

[Al-Bukhari].

1716760.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716760.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716760
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 176
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 176
1716760.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
Jibril (Gabriel) (ﷺ) made a promise with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) to come at a definite hour; that hour came but he did not visit him. There was a staff in the hand of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). He threw it from his hand and said, "Never does Allah back out of His Promise, nor do His messengers." Then he noticed a puppy under his bed and said, "O 'Aishah, when did this dog enter?" She said: "By Allah, I don't know." He then commanded that it should be turned out. No sooner than had they expelled it, Jibril came and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him, "You promised to visit me. I waited for you but you did not come." Whereupon he said: "The dog kept me from coming. We do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture."

[Muslim].

1716770.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716770.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716770
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 177
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 177
1716770.text:
Abul-Haiyaj Haiyan bin Husain said:
'Ali bin Abu Talib (May Allah be pleased with him) said to me: "Shall I not send you to do a task that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had assigned to me? Spare no portrait unwiped out, and leave not a high grave unlevelled."

[Muslim].

1716780.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716780.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716780
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 178
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 178
1716780.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who keeps a dog other than one for guarding the fields or herds or hunting, will lose two Qirat every day out of his rewards."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716790.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716790.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716790
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 179
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 179
1716790.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who keeps a dog, will lose out of his good deeds equal to one Qirat every day, except one who keeps it for guarding the fields or the herd."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

In a narration of Muslim, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) is reported to have said: "He who keeps a dog for any reason other than to guard his property (lands) or his flock of sheep, his good deeds equal to two Qirat will be deducted every day."

1716800.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716800.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716800
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 180
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 180
1716800.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Angels do not accompany the travellers who have with them a dog or a bell."

[Muslim].

1716810.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716810.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716810
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 181
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 181
1716810.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "The bell is one of the musical instruments of Satan."

[Muslim].

1716820.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716820.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716820
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 182
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 182
1716820.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited riding a camel which eats dung, or animal or human waste.

[Abu Dawud].

1716830.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716830.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716830
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 183
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 183
1716830.text:
Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Spitting in the mosque is a sin, and its expiation is that the spittle should be buried in earth."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716840.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716840.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716840
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 184
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 184
1716840.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saw spittle or snot or sputum, sticking to the wall towards Qiblah and scratched it off.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716850.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716850.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716850
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 185
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 185
1716850.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "It is not proper to use the mosque for urinating or easing oneself. They are merely built for the remembrance of Allah and the recitation of the Qur'an", or as he stated.

[Muslim].

1716860.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716860.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716860
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 186
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 186
1716860.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If anyone hears a man inquiring in the mosque about something he has lost, he should say: 'La raddaha Allahu 'alaika (May Allah not restore it to you),' for mosques are not built for this purpose."

[Muslim]

1716870.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716870.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716870
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 187
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 187
1716870.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah said, "When you see someone buying or selling in the mosque, say to him: 'La arbaha-Allahu tijarataka (May Allah not make your bargain profitable)!' When you see someone announcing something lost in it, say: 'May Allah not restore it to you!"'

[At-Tirmidhi].

1716880.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716880.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716880
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 188
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 188
1716880.text:
Buraidah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
A man announced (the loss of his camel) in the mosque, uttering these words: "Has any one seen my red camel?" Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "May it not be restored to you! The mosques are built for what they are meant to be (i.e., prayer, remembrance of Allah, acquiring knowledge, etc.)."

[Muslim].

1716890.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716890.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716890
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 189
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 189
1716890.text:
'Amr bin Shu'aib on the authority of his grandfather (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited (us) from buying and selling in the mosque; (he also prohibited us from) making announcement in it about something lost and from reciting poems in it.

[Abu Dawud and At- Tirmidhi].

1716900.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716900.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716900
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 190
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 190
1716900.text:
As-Sa'ib bin Yazid (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
While I was in the mosque, someone threw a pebble at me, and when I looked up, I saw that it was 'Umar bin Al-Khattab, who said: "Go and call me these two men." I brought them and 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) asked them: "Where are you from?" On their replying that they belonged to At-Taif, he said: "Had you been the inhabitants of Al-Madinah, I would have given you a beating for raising your voices in the mosque of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)."

[Al- Bukhari].

1716910.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716910.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716910
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 191
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 191
1716910.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "He who has eaten garlic should not come to our mosque."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

The narration in Muslim is: "He who has eaten garlic should not come to our mosques."

1716920.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716920.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716920
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 192
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 192
1716920.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "He who has eaten from this plant (i.e., garlic) should not approach us and should not offer Salat (prayer) along with us."

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim].

1716930.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716930.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716930
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 193
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 193
1716930.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "He who has eaten garlic or onion should keep away from us or our mosques."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

The narration in Muslim is: "He who has eaten onion or garlic or leek should not approach our mosque, because the angels are also offended by the strong smells) that offend the children of Adam."

[Muslim].

1716940.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716940.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716940
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 194
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 194
1716940.text:
It has been narrated that 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with him) said in the sermon of Friday prayer:
"O you people! You eat garlic and onion. I think the odour of these to be very offensive. I saw that if the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) happened to find a man with such offensive odour in the mosque, he would order him to be taken out of the mosque and sent to Al-Baqi'. He who wants to eat any of these, should cook them till their odour dies out.

[Muslim].

1716950.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716950.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716950
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 195
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 195
1716950.text:
Mu'adh bin Anas Al-Juhani (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade (us) from sitting with our legs drawn up to our belly (Ihtiba') during the Friday Khutbah (religious talk before the prayer).

[Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi].

1716960.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716960.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716960
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 196
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 196
1716960.text:
Umm Salamah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When anyone of you intends to sacrifice the animal and enter in the month of Dhul-Hijjah, he should not get his hair cut or nails pared till he has offered his sacrifice."

[Muslim].

1716970.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716970.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716970
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 197
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 197
1716970.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Allah has prohibited you from taking an oath by your fathers. He who must take an oath, may do so by swearing in the Name of Allah or he should remain silent."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1716980.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716980.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716980
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 198
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 198
1716980.text:
'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Swear neither by the name of Taghut (i.e., false deities, false leaders, etc.) nor by your fathers."

[Muslim].

1716990.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1716990.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1716990
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 199
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 199
1716990.text:
Buraidah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who swears by Amanah (trust) is not one of us."

[Abu Dawud with authentic Isnad].

1717000.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717000.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717000
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 200
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 200
1717000.text:
Buraidah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If anyone swears that in such and such case he will be free from Islam and afterwards he turns out to be a liar, he will be as he has sworn; but if he is speaking the truth, he will not revert safely to Islam."

[Abu Dawud].

1717010.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717010.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717010
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 201
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 201
1717010.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
I heard a man saying: "No, by the Ka'bah." I admonished him: "Do not swear by any thing besides Allah, for I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, 'He who swears by anyone or anything other than Allah, has indeed committed an act of Kufr or Shirk'."

[At- Tirmidhi].

[Some 'Ulama' are of the opinion that the words of the Prophet (ﷺ) that "He who swears by anyone or anything other than Allah has indeed committed an act of Kufr or Shirk," are in the nature of extreme admonition. And in fact, it is not Shirk. The same applies to the saying of the Prophet (ﷺ), who said, "showing off is Shirk."]

1717020.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717020.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717020
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 202
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 202
1717020.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "He who takes oath to acquire the property of a Muslim unjustly will meet Allah and He will be angry with him" then he recited:

"Verily, those who purchase a small gain at the cost of Allah's Covenant and their oaths, they shall have no portion in the Hereafter. Neither will Allah speak to them nor look at them on the Day of Resurrection nor will He purify them, and they shall have a painful torment." (3:77)

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717030.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717030.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717030
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 203
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 203
1717030.text:
Abu Umamah Iyas bin Tha'labah Al-Harithi (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "He who misappropriates the right of a Muslim by taking a false oath, Allah will condemn him to the fire of Hell and will forbid Jannah for him." A person asked: "O Messenger of Allah, even if it is something insignificant?" He replied, "Yes, even if it is the twig of the Arak tree."

[Muslim].

1717040.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717040.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717040
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 204
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 204
1717040.text:
'Abdullah bin 'Amr bin Al-As (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Of the major sins are: Associating anything in worship with Allah, disobedience to the parents, killing without justification and taking a false oath (intentionally)."

[Al- Bukhari].

Another narration is: A bedouin came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and asked him: "O Messenger of Allah, what are the cardinal sins?" He (ﷺ) replied, "Associating anything with Allah in worship." The man asked: "(What is) next?" The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) replied, "Al-Yamin Al-Ghamus." He asked: "What do you mean by Al-Yamin Al-Ghamus?" The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) replied, "Swearing falsely to usurp the property of a Muslim."

1717050.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717050.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717050
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 205
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 205
1717050.text:
'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me, "When you take an oath and consider something else to be better than it, make expiation for your oath and choose the better alternative."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717060.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717060.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717060
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 206
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 206
1717060.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When you swear an oath and consider something else to be better than it, make expiation for your oath and do the thing that is better."

[Muslim].

1717070.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717070.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717070
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 207
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 207
1717070.text:
Abu Musa (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Verily, I swear by Allah, if Allah wills, I shall not swear to do something but that if I consider something else to be better than it, then I shall make expiation for my oath and adopt the thing that is better."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717080.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717080.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717080
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 208
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 208
1717080.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Persistence in respect of his oath about his family is more sinful with Allah than the payment of its expiation prescribed by Allah."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717090.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717090.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717090
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 209
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 209
1717090.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported:
The Ayah: "Allah will not punish you for what is unintentional in your oaths ..." was revealed in respect of those persons who are in the habit of repeating: 'No, by Allah'; and 'Yes, by Allah.'

[Al- Bukhari].

1717100.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717100.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717100
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 210
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 210
1717100.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "Swearing produces a ready sale for a commodity, but blots out the blessing."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717110.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717110.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717110
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 211
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 211
1717110.text:
Abu Qatadah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "Beware of excessive swearing in sale, because it may promote trade but this practice will eliminate the blessing."

[Muslim].

1717120.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717120.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717120
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 212
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 212
1717120.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "No one should ask in the Face of Allah for anything except Jannah."

[Abu Dawud].

1717130.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717130.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717130
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 213
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 213
1717130.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Grant shelter to him who begs for it in the Name of Allah, give to him who begs in the Name of Allah, accept the invitation of him who invites you, and requite him who does a favour to you, but if you are unable to requite him, go on praying for him till you are sure that you have requited him adequately."

[Abu Dawud and An- Nasa'i].

1717140.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717140.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717140
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 214
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 214
1717140.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "The most disgraceful man near Allah is a man who calls himself (or likes others to call him) Malikul-Amlak (i.e., king of kings)."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717150.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717150.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717150
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 215
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 215
1717150.text:
Buraidah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Do not address a hypocrite with the title of chief, (or similar titles of respect) for even if he deserves this title you will invite Allah's Wrath by using it for him."

[Abu Dawud].

1717160.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717160.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717160
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 216
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 216
1717160.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) visited Umm Sa'ib (or Umm Musaiyyab) and asked her, "What ails you O Umm Sa'ib (or Umm Musaiyyab)? You are shivering." She replied: "It is a fever, may Allah not bless it!" He said to her, "Do not revile fever, for it cleanses out the sins of the sons of Adam in the same way that a furnace removes the dirt of iron."

[Muslim].

1717170.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717170.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717170
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 217
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 217
1717170.text:
Abul-Mundhir Ubaiy bin Ka'b (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Do not revile the wind. When you experience something abominable (about it), supplicate: 'Allahumma inna nas'aluka min khairi hadhihir-rihi, wa khairi ma fiha, wa khairi ma umirat bihi. Wa na'udhu bika min sharri hadhihir-rihi, wa sharri ma fiha, wa sharri ma umirat bihi. (O Allah, we beg of You the good of this wind and the good of that which it contains and the good of that which it has been commanded; and we seek refuge in you from the evil of this wind and the evil of that which it contains and the evil of that which it has been commanded)."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1717180.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717180.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717180
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 218
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 218
1717180.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "The wind is the Blessing of Allah. Sometimes it brings His Mercy and sometimes it brings His Chastisement. When you experience it, do not revile it but beg of Allah its good; and seek Allah's Refuge against its evil."

[Abu Dawud with good Isnad].

1717190.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717190.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717190
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 219
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 219
1717190.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
Whenever the wind blew strongly, The Prophet (ﷺ) would say: "Allahumma inni as'aluka khairaha, wa khaira ma fiha, wa khaira ma ursilat bihi. Wa a'udhu bika min sharriha, wa sharri ma fiha, wa sharri ma ursilat bihi. (O Allah, I beg of You its good and the good of that which it contains and the good of the purpose for which it has been sent; and I seek Your Refuge from its evil and the evil of that which it contains and the evil of the purpose for which it has been sent)."

[Muslim].

1717200.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717200.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717200
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 220
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 220
1717200.text:
Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Do not revile the rooster for it wakes you up for prayer."

[Abu Dawud].

1717210.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717210.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717210
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 221
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 221
1717210.text:
Zaid bin Khalid (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) led the Fajr prayer at Al-Hudaibiyyah after a rainfall during the night. At the conclusion of prayer, he turned towards the people and said, "Do you know what your Rubb has said?" They replied: "Allah and His Messenger know better." Upon this he remarked, "He has said: 'Some of My slaves have entered the morning as My believers and some as unbelievers. He who said: We have had a rainfall due to the Grace and Mercy of Allah, believes in Me and disbelieves in the stars; and he who said: We have had a rainfall due to the rising of such and such star, disbelieves in Me and affirms his faith in the stars."'

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717220.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717220.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717220
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 222
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 222
1717220.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When a person calls his brother (in Islam) a disbeliever, one of them will certainly deserve the title. If the addressee is so as he has asserted, the disbelief of the man is confirmed, but if it is untrue, then it will revert to him."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717230.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717230.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717230
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 223
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 223
1717230.text:
Abu Dharr (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "If somebody accuses another of disbelief or calls him the enemy of Allah, such an accusation will revert to him (the accuser) if the accused is innocent."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717240.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717240.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717240
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 224
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 224
1717240.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "A true believer does not taunt or curse or abuse or talk indecently."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1717250.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717250.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717250
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 225
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 225
1717250.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Indecency does not leave anything untainted and decency does not leave anything ungraced and embellished."

[At- Tirmidhi].

1717260.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717260.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717260
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 226
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 226
1717260.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Ruined are Al-Mutanatti'un." He repeated this thrice.

[Muslim].

1717270.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717270.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717270
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 227
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 227
1717270.text:
'Abdullah bin 'Amr bin Al-As (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Verily, Allah dislikes an eloquent person who rolls his tongue as a cow rolls its tongue (while eating)."

[Abu Dawud and At- Tirmidhi].

1717280.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717280.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717280
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 228
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 228
1717280.text:
Jabir bin 'Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The dearest and the closest of you to me on the Day of Resurrection will be those who are the best in behaviour; and the most hateful and the farthest from me on the Day of Resurrection will be the talkative and the most pretentious and the most rhetorical."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1717290.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717290.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717290
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 229
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 229
1717290.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "None of you should say: 'My soul has become evil.' He should say: 'My soul is in bad shape."'

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717300.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717300.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717300
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 230
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 230
1717300.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "None of you should use the word Al-Karm for grapes, for Al-Karm is a Muslim (worthy of respect)."

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim]

Another narration is: "Verily, Al-Karm is the heart of a true believer."

Another narration is: "People have named grapes as Al-Karm; verily, only the heart of a believer is Al-Karm."

1717310.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717310.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717310
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 231
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 231
1717310.text:
Wa'il bin Hujr (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not say Al-Karm when talking about grapes but say Al-'Inab or Al-Habalah."

[Muslim].

1717320.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717320.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717320
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 232
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 232
1717320.text:
Ibn Mas'ud (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "No woman should touch another woman's body and then describe the details of her figure to her husband in such a manner as if he was looking at her."

[Al- Bukhari].

1717330.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717330.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717330
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 233
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 233
1717330.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "You must not supplicate: 'O Allah! forgive me if You wish; O Allah bestow mercy on me if You wish.' But beg from Allah with certitude for no one has the power to compel Allah."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim]

Another narration of Muslim is: "A supplication should be made in full confidence and one should persistently express his desire (before Allah) in his supplication, for no bounty is too great for Allah to bestow (upon his slaves)."

1717340.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717340.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717340
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 234
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 234
1717340.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When one of you supplicates, let him be decisive and he should not say: 'O Allah, bestow upon me such and such if You wish', because no one has the power to compel Him."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717350.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717350.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717350
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 235
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 235
1717350.text:
Hudhaifah bin Yaman (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Say not: 'What Allah wills and so-and-so wills', but say: 'What Allah wills, and then what so-and-so wills."'

[Abu Dawud with authentic Isnad].

1717360.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717360.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717360
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 236
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 236
1717360.text:
Abu Barzah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) disliked going to bed before the 'Isha' (night) prayer and indulging in conversation after it."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717370.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717370.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717370
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 237
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 237
1717370.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
Once, towards the end of his life, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) concluded the 'Isha' (night) prayer and said, "After one hundred years from tonight none of the people on the surface of the earth will survive."

[Al- Bukhari and Muslim].

1717380.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717380.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717380
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 238
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 238
1717380.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
Once the Prophet (ﷺ) delayed the 'Isha' (night) prayer till midnight. He (ﷺ) turned to us after the prayer and said, "All the people slept after offering their prayers, but you who waited, will be accounted as if you were engaged in your prayer throughout the period."

[Al- Bukhari].

1717390.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717390.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717390
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 239
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 239
1717390.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If a man calls his wife to his bed and she refuses, and thus he spends the night angry with her, the angels continue cursing her till the morning."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717400.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717400.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717400
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 240
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 240
1717400.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "It is not lawful for a woman to observe an optional Saum (fast) without the permission of her husband when he is at home. Nor should she allow anyone to enter his house without his permission."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717410.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717410.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717410
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 241
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 241
1717410.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Does he who raises up his head before the Imam not fear that Allah will make his head that of a donkey or make his appearance similar to that of donkey?"

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717420.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717420.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717420
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 242
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 242
1717420.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
We are prohibited from placing the hand on the side during As-Salat (the prayer).

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717430.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717430.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717430
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 243
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 243
1717430.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "No Salat (prayer) should be performed when the food has been served, nor should it be performed when a person is in need of relieving himself."

[Muslim].

1717435.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717435.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717435
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 244
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 244
1717435.text:
Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "How is it that some people raise their eyes towards the sky during As-Salat (the prayer)?" He stressed (this point) and added, "People must refrain from raising their eyes towards heaven in Salat (prayer), or else their sights will certainly be snatched away."

[Al-Bukhari].

1717440.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717440.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717440
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 245
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 245
1717440.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said:
I asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about random looks in Salat (prayer), and he replied, "It is something which Satan snatches from the slave's Salat."

[Al-Bukhari].

1717450.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717450.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717450
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 246
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 246
1717450.text:
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me, "Beware of looking around in Salat (prayer), because random looks in Salat are a cause of destruction. If there should be no help from it, it is permissible in the voluntary and not in obligatory Salat."

[At-Tirmidhi].

1717460.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717460.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717460
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 247
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 247
1717460.text:
Abu Marthad Kannaz bin Husain (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: "Do not offer Salat (prayer) facing the graves and do not sit on them."

[Muslim].

1717470.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717470.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717470
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 248
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 248
1717470.text:
Abul-Juhaim 'Abdullah bin Al-Harith (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If the person who passes in front of a praying person, realizes the enormity of the sinfulness of this act, it will have been better for him to wait forty than to pass in front of him."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

[The narrator was not sure whether the Prophet (ﷺ) said forty days, months or years.]

1717480.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717480.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717480
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 249
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 249
1717480.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "When the Iqamah is called, no prayer should be performed except the obligatory prayer."

[Muslim].

1717490.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717490.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717490
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 250
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 250
1717490.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not choose the Friday night among all other nights for standing in (Tahajjud) prayer, and do not choose Friday among all other days for Saum (fasting) except that one you have accustomed to."

[Muslim].

1717500.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717500.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717500
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 251
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 251
1717500.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as saying: "None of you should observe fast on Friday except that he should observe fast either one day before it or one day after it."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717510.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717510.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717510
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 252
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 252
1717510.text:
Muhammad bin 'Abbad (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
I asked Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him). Did the Prophet (ﷺ) prohibit fasting on Friday?" He said, "Yes."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717520.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717520.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717520
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 253
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 253
1717520.text:
Juwairiyah bint Al-Harith (May Allah be pleased with her), the Mother of the Believers, said that the Prophet (ﷺ) visited her on a Friday and she was observing fast. He asked, "Did you observe fast yesterday?" She said, "No." He asked, "Do you intend to observe fast tomorrow?" She said, "No." He said, "In that case, give up your fast today."

[Al-Bukhari].

1717530.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717530.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717530
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 254
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 254
1717530.text:
Abu Hurairah and 'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited observing continuous voluntary fasts beyond one day.

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717540.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717540.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717540
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 255
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 255
1717540.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited observing continuous fasts beyond one day. The Companions submitted: "But you do it." He replied, "I am not like you. I am given to eat and to drink (from Allah)."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717550.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717550.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717550
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 256
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 256
1717550.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "It is much better for one of you to sit on a live coal, which will burn his clothes and get to his skin than to sit on a grave."

[Muslim].

1717560.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717560.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717560
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 257
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 257
1717560.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade that the graves should be plastered (made into permanent structures), used as sitting places (for the people) or building over them.

[Muslim].

1717570.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717570.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717570
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 258
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 258
1717570.text:
Jarir bin Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "If a slave runs away from his master, his responsibility to him is absolved."

[Muslim].

1717580.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717580.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717580
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 259
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 259
1717580.text:
Jarir bin Abdullah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "When the slave runs away from his master, his Salat (prayer) will not be accepted."

[Muslim].

Another narration is: "He is guilty of disbelief (i.e., in case he believes in the lawfulness of doing so)."

1717590.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717590.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717590
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 260
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 260
1717590.text:
'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) reported:
The Quraish were anxious about a woman from Banu Makhzum who had committed theft and asked : "Who will speak to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about her?" Then they said: "No one will be bold enough to do so except Usamah bin Zaid, the (Companion who was) dearly loved by the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)." So Usamah (May Allah be pleased with him) spoke to him and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) (angrily) said, "Are you interceding regarding one of the punishments prescribed by Allah?" He then got up and delivered an address in which he said, "Indeed what destroyed the people before you was just that when a person of high rank among them committed a theft, they spared him; but if the same crime was done by a poor person they inflicted the prescribed punishment on him. I swear by Allah that if Fatimah daughter of Muhammad should steal, I would have her hand cut off."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

In another narration 'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) said: (Upon hearing the intercession of Usamah), the face of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) changed color (because of anger) and he said, "Do you dare to intercede in matters prescribed by Allah?" Usamah pleaded: "O Messenger of Allah! Pray for my forgiveness." 'Aishah (May Allah be pleased with her) added: Thereafter the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) gave orders to have that woman's hand cut off.

1717600.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717600.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717600
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 261
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 261
1717600.text:
Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Avoid two habits which provoke cursing." The Companions said: "What are those things which provoke cursing?" He said, "Relieving on the thoroughfares or under the shades where people take shelter and rest."

[Muslim].

1717610.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717610.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717610
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 262
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 262
1717610.text:
Jabir (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade urinating into stagnant water.

[Muslim].

1717620.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717620.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717620
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 263
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 263
1717620.text:
An-Nu'man bin Bashir (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
My father took me to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and said to him: "I have gifted one of my slaves to this son of mine." The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Have you given such gift to every son of yours?" He replied, "No." Thereupon he said, "Take this gift back."

Another narration is: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Be mindful of your obligation to Allah and do justice in respect of your children." My father came back and revoked his gift.

Another narration is: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) asked, "Have you other children besides this one?" He said, "Yes." The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) asked, "Have you awarded a gift like this to all of them." He said, "No." The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "I am not going to bear witness to this act of injustice."

Another narration is: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) asked, "Do you not except goodness from all of them as you except from him?" He said, "Yes, of course." The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Then don't do this (i.e., do not give a gift to one son only)."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717630.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717630.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717630
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 264
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 264
1717630.text:
Zainab bint Abu Salamah (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
I went to Umm Habibah (May Allah be pleased with her) the wife of the Prophet (ﷺ), when her father Abu Sufyan bin Harb (May Allah be pleased with him) died. Umm Habibah (May Allah be pleased with her) sent for a yellow coloured perfume or something else like it, and she applied it to a slave-girl and then rubbed it on her own cheeks and said: "By Allah, I have no need for perfume, I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying from the pulpit, 'It is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for the dead beyond three days, except for the death of her husband; in which case the period of mourning is of four months and ten days."' Zainab said: I then visited Zainab, daughter of Jahsh (May Allah be pleased with her) when her brother died; she sent for perfume and applied it and then said: "Beware! By Allah, I don't feel any need of perfume but I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying from the pulpit, 'It is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn the dead beyond three days except in case of her husband (for whom the period is) four months and ten days."'

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim]

1717640.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717640.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717640
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 265
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 265
1717640.text:
Anas bin Malik (May Allah be pleased with him) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade that a person in the city should make a deal on behalf of a villager on commission even if he is his real brother."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim]

1717650.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717650.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717650
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 266
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 266
1717650.text:
Ibn 'Umar (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Do not meet the merchandise till they arrive in the market."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717660.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717660.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717660
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 267
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 17, Hadith 267
1717660.text:
Ibn 'Abbas (May Allah be pleased with them) said:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "The caravans carrying merchandise should not be met on the way to purchase from them; a man in the city should not sell for a man of the desert."

Tawus asked him (Ibn 'Abbas): "What do these words really imply?" He said: "He should not work as an agent on his behalf."

[Al-Bukhari and Muslim].

1717670.book: The Book of the Prohibited actions
1717670.reference:
Reference  : Riyad as-Salihin 1717670
In-book reference  : Book 17, Hadith 268
